name: Ramsey Theory
description: Ramsey theory states that complete disorder is impossible. It explores how order emerges in large enough structures.

name: Splines
description: Splines are smooth curves used in computer graphics and interpolation.

name: Prime Numbers
description: Prime numbers are integers greater than 1 that have no divisors other than 1 and themselves.

name: Pigeonhole Principle
description: The principle stating that if n items are placed in m containers, where n > m, at least one container must hold more than one item.

visuals.description: Visual representation of the pigeonhole principle.

name: Monte Carlo Method
description: A computational algorithm that uses random sampling to obtain numerical results and solve problems that might be deterministic in principle.

name: No-Free-Lunch Theorem
description: A theorem stating that no optimization algorithm performs better than others when performance is averaged across all possible problems.

name: Four Color Theorem
description: The theorem stating that any map can be colored using no more than four colors such that no two adjacent regions share the same color.

visuals.description: Illustration of the Four Color Theorem.

name: Bayesian Inference
description: A method of statistical inference that updates the probability for a hypothesis as more evidence or information becomes available.

name: Markov Chains
description: A stochastic process that undergoes transitions from one state to another based on certain probabilistic rules.

name: Euler's Identity
description: The mathematical formula e^(iÏ€) + 1 = 0, which is considered one of the most beautiful equations in mathematics.

name: Artificial life
description: Artificial life (ALife or A-Life) is a field of study wherein researchers examine systems related to natural life, its processes, and its evolution.

name: Synthetic biology
description: Synthetic biology (SynBio) is a multidisciplinary field of science that focuses on living systems and organisms.

name: Geomelting
description: GeoMelt is a process by which dangerous, contaminated material is mixed with clean soil and melted to create a leach-resistant glass product.

name: Transdifferentiation
description: Transdifferentiation is the process in which one mature somatic cell is transformed into another mature somatic cell without an intermediate state.

name: Turritopsis dohrnii
description: Turritopsis dohrnii, also known as the immortal jellyfish, is a species of small, biologically immortal jellyfish.

name: Dedifferentiation
description: Dedifferentiation is a process by which cells become less specialized and return to an earlier cell state within the same lineage.

name: Metaplasia
description: Metaplasia is the transformation of one differentiated cell type to another differentiated cell type.

name: Biological immortality
description: Biological immortality is a state in which the rate of mortality from senescence is stable or decreasing.

name: Intelligent design
description: Intelligent design is a pseudoscientific argument for the existence of God, presented by its proponents as an evidence-based scientific theory.

name: Nanoparticle-biomolecule conjugate
description: A nanoparticle-biomolecule conjugate is a nanoparticle with biomolecules attached to its surface.

name: Nanoreactor
description: Nanoreactors are chemical reactors that operate at the nanoscale, crucial for nanofoundry operations.

name: Mind uploading
description: Mind uploading is the hypothetical process of scanning and transferring a conscious mind from a brain to a computer.
